meanings.sent1: She miscolored the picture by using the wrong crayon.
meanings.sent2: The artist accidentally miscolored the sky purple instead of blue.
meanings.sent3: The little girl miscolored her hair with markers, thinking it would look pretty.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to miscolor the walls with neon paint ended up looking like a messy rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The chef miscolored the icing on the cake, creating a unique and unexpected design.

meanings.definition: Having the wrong color or shade.
meanings.sent1: The miscolored shirt stood out among the rest in the store.
meanings.sent2: The miscolored leaves on the tree indicated the changing of seasons.
meanings.sent3: The miscolored socks made him look like he was wearing two different pairs.
meanings.sent4: Her miscolored hair resembled a patchwork quilt of various hues.
meanings.sent5: The miscolored clouds at sunset painted the sky in a surreal palette.
